column1: Words of Wisdom
Rebooting fixes 99% of all problems. The other 1% requires coffee.
The cloud is just someone else's computer.
To err is human; to blame it on a computer is even more human.
There's no place like 127.0.0.1.
A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
In code we trust, all others bring data.
Never trust a computer you can’t throw out a window.
Have you tried turning it off and on again?
The best things in life are free; the second best are very expensive.
Documentation: The worst part of programming, but the first thing users read.
The only problem with troubleshooting is that sometimes trouble shoots back.
Computers are like air conditioners: they stop working when you open Windows.
There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary and those who don't.
You can't spell 'virus' without 'u' and 'i'.
The programmer's national anthem is 'Hello, World!'
Artificial intelligence is no match for natural stupidity.
It's not a bug; it's an undocumented feature.
Ethernet is for wimps. Real men punch holes in walls and pull cable.
An infinite loop walks into a bar. The bartender says, 'See you tomorrow!'
Coding is 10% writing code and 90% figuring out why it doesn’t work.
There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and benchmarks.
If at first you don’t succeed, call it version 1.0.
Algorithm: Word used by programmers when they don't want to explain what they did.
A hacker does for love what others would not do for money.
Why do Java developers wear glasses? Because they don't C#.
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
I would love to change the world, but they won’t give me the source code.
There is no 'I' in team, but there is a 'U' in bug.
Unix is user friendly. It’s just selective about who its friends are.
I think, therefore I code.
Hello, I'm a Mac. And I’m a PC. And I’m Linux; I’m just better.
An SQL query goes into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks: 'Can I join you?'
Programmers are tools for converting caffeine into code.
Life would be much easier if I had the source code.
The computer is mightier than the pen, the sword, and usually, the programmer.
A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.
Don't worry if it doesn't work right. If everything did, you'd be out of a job.
If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
Beware of programmers who carry screwdrivers.
There is no Ctrl-Z in life.
The only constant in programming is change.
In theory, there’s no difference between theory and practice. In practice, there is.
Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
Siri, write my code.
Keep calm and call the sysadmin.
The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kickboxing.
There is an easy way and a hard way. The hard part is finding the easy way.
I don’t need a hard disk in my computer if I can get to the server faster.
The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
The internet: where men are men, women are men, and children are FBI agents.
There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
Don’t comment bad code; rewrite it.
The goal of Computer Science is to build something that will last at least until we’ve finished building it.
It works on my machine.
Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
Computers do not solve problems, they execute solutions.
The best part of waking up is not knowing what your code will break today.
Software and cathedrals are much the same — first we build them, then we pray.
A misplaced semicolon can ruin your whole day.
The most dangerous phrase in the language is, 'We've always done it this way.'
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along would destroy civilization.
Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
There is nothing quite so permanent as a quick fix.
Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it’s released. Beta is Latin for 'still doesn’t work.'
Programmer: A person who fixed a problem you didn’t know you had in a way you don’t understand.
All computers wait at the same speed.
The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
If Java had true garbage collection, most programs would delete themselves upon execution.
You can't spell 'software' without 'soft'.
There’s no place like 127.0.0.1.
I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
Computers make very fast, very accurate mistakes.
You can’t spell 'geek' without 'EE'.
A good programmer looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
Programming is like sex: one mistake and you have to support it for the rest of your life.
God is real, unless declared integer.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
The future is here. It's just not evenly distributed yet.
I am not a great programmer; I am just a good programmer with great habits.
Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.
If it works, don’t touch it.
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
The Internet is the most important single development in the history of human communication since the invention of call waiting.
Real programmers count from 0.
Backup plan? I just hit Ctrl+S.
A computer lets you make more mistakes faster than any invention in human history.
